note: The country Nauru already eradicated polio in 1910 which explains the starting date of this map. The first "larger" countries' eradication of polio can be seen after 1960.
title: Progress towards polio eradication
subtitle: Countries with [wild poliovirus](#dod:wild-poliovirus) transmission are considered endemic. Countries are shown as polio-free (not certified) if they have demonstrated the absence of wild poliovirus transmission. When all countries in a WHO region have recorded zero cases for three consecutive years while meeting surveillance targets, the region can be certified as polio-free.
